ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned strategies to compose music using the vernacular of musical theater. I also learned how to efficiently produce new music at a consistent schedule, and how to present my compositions. I also learned how to discuss and critique musical theater works.

- a ton of experience composing for musical theater
- knowledge of effective tactics in lyric and songwriting
- feedback and connections from excellent student composers
- industry insight and advice from Professor Frankel

I got better at writing for the voice and for musical theater! This class also challenged me way more than I was expecting to write lyrics (THIS IS NOT IN THE COURSE DESCRIPTION!)  which was a good thing, as I suck at them, and it was a really great trial by fire for that!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Writing a song every week is very helpful, but also very stressful. I think the course could possibly improve if there were more partner projects and also if some projects were 2 weeks long. This would also give us more class time to really examine everyone's work. We had two projects where we partnered up, and these were the most fun and educational.

Weekly assignments were very helpful for me in producing a lot of new material. I think the class could have benefited from a single 1-on-1 meeting with the professor though at some point during the semester to discuss the works I produced as a whole, since each week was focused on a single assignment and there was no structured time to discuss my progress throughout the semester.

strengths:
- this course forces you to write a TON of music, which is probably the best possible way to learn about composition, and it is so meaningful looking back at the semester having accomplished so much
- Prof. Frankel is excellent! He gives great feedback and is incredible kind and invested in his students

weaknesses:
- I would like slightly more music-related feedback. I think feedback leaned slightly more towards lyrics, and usually I knew exactly which of my lyrics were bad anyways (I just didn't have time to change them because of the tight turnaround). Maybe this is just me, but in that case it may be helpful to start the course (or each presentation) by saying what specifically each student is looking for feedback on? I know we did this for one assignment and it was helpful!

This was a really excellent class (taught by Prof. Frankel this semester). Class always had a really great vibe, and everyone was really supportive of each other's work. I genuinely had a great time working on the assignments for the class and then sharing them in class, and I feel like I grew as a musical theater composer. 

Sometimes, I wished that Prof Frankel would critique our compositions more/a little more harshly, or that the critique wasn't completely driven by student comments  I actually would have loved a little bit more faculty advice/less student discussion at times!

But I had a great time in this class and highly would recommend taking it with Prof. Frankel!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It was very challenging, but very worth it. You get a lot of great feedback on your pieces and a lot of great experiences writing, critiquing, and presenting.

Yes!!!! This was one of my favorite courses I have taken at Yale. I learned so much and am so proud of the work I accomplished this semester! I knew almost nothing about musical theater before taking this, but as a songwriter it was completely doable.

I would recommend this class to anyone who is comfortable composing and composing a lot. This is definitely not a beginner class for composition or for writing for the voice. It is really important that you have a grasp of music notation and engraving for voice and piano before taking this class  it was very clear that some students who were a little more uncertain about those fundamentals struggled more or had to put in a lot more time. But this is a great class that gets you to write A LOT (bring in a song EVERY week!) and to get a lot of good critique of your work  which is a super valuable way to learn and grow as an artist!
